title: Kevin Maguire: Bluffing Boris wants to ditch all our rights
text:

Demanding a Brexit second vote for MPs while denying the great British public a second referendum is classic Boris Johnson hypocrisy.

Bluster from the cynical liar, a Tory Prime Minister making it up as he goes along, is unable to mask the humiliation of a lost extension rebellion.

Start digging a deep Halloween ditch when his prospects of delivering Brexit by 31 October are vanishingly small.

We should hold him to that vow to die politically.

That, I concede, is likely to be another immediate broken promise from a shameless stranger to the truth.

(Image: PA)

Behaving like a spoiled brat, refusing to sign the letter he vowed never to send, only emphasised the desperation of a petulant Johnson without, admitted a Tory Cabinet Minister sitting on the committee overseeing Brexit preparations, a master plan.

The Prime Minister who lives life on the hoof, doing what’s best for him at any mo, will continue bluffing in the hope of making Britain poorer and weaker with a bad deal worse than Theresa May’s.

Johnson’s surrendered control of events, so even if Saturday’s Shambles is reversed he’ll never regain full control of events in Parliament.

The answer from a senior member of Jeremy’s Corbyn’s Shadow Cabinet - “I haven’t the foggiest” - when I asked what happens next was refreshingly honest.

What we can see is Labour swinging towards a fresh referendum before a General Election probably delayed until next Spring.

The sharp Brexit prosecutor-in-chief Keir Starmer announcing he’ll attempt this week to secure a people’s vote between the best deal, remaining in Europe, and Johnson knocking £50bn off the economy to leave everyone £2,000 worse off, is a guerrilla war.

Johnson’s “Get Brexit Done” slogan’s the most vacuous in history when approval by MPs for his con trick to dismantle workers, consumer and environmental rights triggers a year of negotiations on trading with Europe.

Just as getting a leg hacked off doesn’t let you run again, ramming Brexit through Parliament isn’t closure.

Are you suffering Brexit fatigue? Sorry to bring bad news but we’re not at the end of the beginning never mind the beginning of the end.
description: Behaving like a spoiled brat only emphasises the desperation of a petulant Johnson
